Response: Neurosurgical Associates of Northwest Ohio LLC
NA; we didn't have any changes

- We have worked closely with physicians and other members of an interdisciplinary team to establish and implement a diagnosis- triggered clinical care pathway for the episode. The spinal fusion, non-cervical care pathway extends from the decision for surgery through the 90 day episode. SNF pathways have also been developed and implemented with our system SNFs. - We have introduced a care navigator into the care pathway for the episode patients. The care navigator follows the patient through their episode of care. Preadmission care navigation for the episode patients includes identifying and mitigating risks, educating the patient and family about the procedure, and preparing for discharge. The care navigator addresses some socio-economic barriers to care, including medication affordability, caregiver support, health literacy and transportation, discharge planning. -We have focused on patient engagement and shared decision making for the spinal fusion non-cervical bundle through the inclusion of a mandatory educational class for patient and caregiver. The class is  embedded within preadmission testing. This has resulted in patients being more prepared for surgery, including being fitted in advance for any required bracing to encourage early ambulation within the inpatient stay.-During inpatient stays, we use structured patient communication boards in patient rooms and structured inpatient rounding by managers. -Any readmissions are reviewed by an interdisciplinary group including physicians to address opportunities for improvement.

Our biggest challenge is that we have relatively low volume, and therefore greater risk of variation. However, we took on this program with the belief that it is important to learn how to manage care across the episode.
NA; we are a Non-Convener Participant
Our Participating Practitioners are employed providers and therefore are required under their employment agreements to comply with the program requirements.

NA; not requiring shared repayments by partners
We have elected the waivers and have contracts with SNFs is place, but we have not had an occasion to use the waiver for a patient yet.

The BPCI-A program leadership roles are being incorporated into the job description of key personnel when a transition is made; we have a leadership work group that oversees the BPCI-A program that meets biweekly, as well as an executive level oversight committee that meets quarterly.

The beneficiary letter is provided at the time of preadmission testing during the  education class prior to their inpatient stay if possible. If not provided in advance during the class, it is given during the inpatient stay.
Implementing systematic advanced care planning is challenging. We also need to receive the CPT codes for ACPs in the CMS data.
